revised_title: Gametogenesis and Fertilization in Plasmodium yoelii nigeriensis: A Transmission Electron Microscope Study
tldr: This study examines the ultrastructure of gametogenesis and fertilization in the malaria parasite Plasmodium yoelii nigeriensis using a transmission electron microscope. The research focuses on the micro- and macro-gametocytes, their nuclear and cytoplasmic changes during gametogenesis, and the process of fertilization. The findings provide insights into the biology of malaria parasites and contribute to the understanding of their life cycle.
